Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to model physical problems.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students will be able to do signal and image analysis using transform learning
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to understand and present current research papers published in top-tier journals and conferences in this area
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are able to do advanced project work in this area

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Mathematical preliminaries: Signal spaces and operators, concept of basis, orthogonal and biorthogonal basis, inner product, norm, Frames, Riesz basis
Introduction to transforms, Sampling rate conversions, upsampling and downsampling, 1-D discrete wavelet transform, example of Haar wavelet with connection to filterbank
Computational efficiency in realizing filterbanks- Polyphase components
2-D separable and non-separable wavelet transform, Integer wavelet transform; Ridgelets, Curvelets, and directional filterbanks
Dyadic Wavelet Transform Learning in forward and inverse problems
Rational Wavelet Transform Learning in forward and inverse problems
Spasifying Transform Learning- Online learning, overcomplete learning, High dimensional learning; recent approaches
Recent approaches to transform leraning continued…

Resource Material.Textbook: C. S. Burrus, R. A. Gopinath, and H. Guo. Introduction to Wavelets and Wavelet Transforms - A Primer. Prentice Hall, 1997.
Resource Material.Reference Book: C. S. Burrus, R. A. Gopinath, and H. Guo. Introduction to Wavelets and Wavelet Transforms - A Primer. Prentice Hall, 1997.
